title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn volunteers canvassed Boston during a blizzard, offering rides and supplies to the homeless outside.
The blizzard dumped over 16 inches of snow, causing Pine Street Inn shelters to exceed their 585-bed capacity.
Volunteers continue outreach during the storm, with shelters and warming centers open 24/7 to assist those in need.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of departing flights from Logan Airport canceled Tuesday due to a nor'easter impacting New England.
Amtrak trains between Boston and New York were suspended Monday; service hopeful to resume for Tuesday's commute.
Nearly 270 flights already canceled for Tuesday out of Logan; passengers advised to check with airlines.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins must decide on trading Viktor Arvidsson, who has 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games this season.
Arvidsson, acquired for a 2027 fifth-round pick, is a key player as Bruins hold the final Wild Card spot.
Trading Arvidsson could secure a higher draft pick, but might hinder the Bruins' current playoff push.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts schools will remain closed on Feb. 24 due to a severe snowstorm delivering over 30 inches in some areas.
Numerous districts including Boston, Worcester, and Cambridge announced closures as a major winter storm impacts the state.
Blizzard conditions affected the region, resulting in school closures, delayed openings, and reported power outages across Massachusetts.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown initially disliked Mike Vrabel, writing 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during team meetings.
Brown's perspective on Vrabel changed after realizing the coach's demanding standards aimed to build accountability.
Speculation arises about a potential trade for Brown, with Patriots considered a possible destination for the Eagles receiver.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The U.S. women's hockey team declined President Trump's invite to the State of the Union due to scheduling conflicts.
The U.S. men's hockey team, who also won gold at the Olympics, received an invitation for the State of the Union.
Trump joked with the men's team about inviting the women's team while on a call after their Olympic win.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots released running back Antonio Gibson to clear over $3 million in cap space, impacting the roster for offseason plans.
Gibson tore his ACL in Week 5 of 2025, contributing significantly as a running back and kick returner before his injury.
New England seeks a replacement running back to support Rhamondre Stevenson, TreVeyon Henderson, and others on the depth chart.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists have declared a blizzard in parts of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
Blizzard conditions require visibility under 1/4 mile for three hours with winds of at least 35 mph, not just snowfall.
National Weather Service warns of whiteout conditions, power outages, and hazardous travel due to the blizzard, effective until 7 a.m. Tuesday.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Jack Coen photographed blizzard conditions in downtown Boston causing near-whiteout visibility on Monday.
Boston's nor'easter brought heavy snowfall, with 14 inches recorded in Pawtucket, Rhode Island.
The National Weather Service warned of 18-24 inches of snow and strong winds in Massachusetts.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady called WWE 'cute' on Logan Paul's podcast, prompting Randy Orton to express interest in using his RKO move on Brady.
Randy Orton, preparing for his 10th WWE elimination chamber match, placed Tom Brady at the top of his RKO target list.
Tom Brady will participate in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic, joining NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski.
